trans-unit.source: Key Vault Developer's Guide | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Key Vault Developer's Guide | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Developers can use Azure Key Vault to manage cryptographic keys within the Microsoft Azure environment.
trans-unit.target: Developers can use Azure Key Vault to manage cryptographic keys within the Microsoft Azure environment.

trans-unit.source: Azure Key Vault Developer's Guide
trans-unit.target: Azure Key Vault Developer's Guide

trans-unit.source: Developers can use Azure Key Vault to manage cryptographic keys within the Microsoft Azure environment.
trans-unit.target: Developers can use Azure Key Vault to manage cryptographic keys within the Microsoft Azure environment.

trans-unit.source: Key Vault supports multiple key types and algorithms and can be used with hardware security modules (HSM) for high-value customer keys.
trans-unit.target: Key Vault supports multiple key types and algorithms and can be used with hardware security modules (HSM) for high-value customer keys.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you can use Key Vault to securely store secrets which are limited size octet objects with no specific semantics.
trans-unit.target: In addition, you can use Key Vault to securely store secrets which are limited size octet objects with no specific semantics.

trans-unit.source: A key vault can contain a mix of keys and secrets.
trans-unit.target: A key vault can contain a mix of keys and secrets.

trans-unit.source: Access control for the types of objects is independently managed.
trans-unit.target: Access control for the types of objects is independently managed.

trans-unit.source: Users, subject to successful authorization, can do the following:
trans-unit.target: Users, subject to successful authorization, can do the following:

trans-unit.source: Manage cryptographic keys using [Create](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903634.aspx), [Import](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903626.aspx), [Update](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903616.aspx), [Delete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903611.aspx) and other operations
trans-unit.target: Manage cryptographic keys using [Create](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903634.aspx), [Import](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903626.aspx), [Update](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903616.aspx), [Delete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903611.aspx) and other operations

trans-unit.source: Manage secrets using [Get](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903633.aspx), [Update](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn986818.aspx, [Delete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903613.aspx) and other operations
trans-unit.target: Manage secrets using [Get](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903633.aspx), [Update](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn986818.aspx, [Delete](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903613.aspx) and other operations

trans-unit.source: Use cryptographic keys with [Sign](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn878096.aspx)/[Verify](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn878082.aspx), [WrapKey](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn878066.aspx)/[UnwrapKey](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn878079.aspx) and [Encrypt](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn878060.aspx)/[Decrypt](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn878097.aspx) operations
trans-unit.target: Use cryptographic keys with [Sign](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn878096.aspx)/[Verify](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn878082.aspx), [WrapKey](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn878066.aspx)/[UnwrapKey](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn878079.aspx) and [Encrypt](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn878060.aspx)/[Decrypt](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn878097.aspx) operations

trans-unit.source: Operations against key vaults are authenticated and authorized by using Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Operations against key vaults are authenticated and authorized by using Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Programming for Key Vault
trans-unit.target: Programming for Key Vault

trans-unit.source: The Key Vault management system for programmers consists of several interfaces, with REST as the foundation.
trans-unit.target: The Key Vault management system for programmers consists of several interfaces, with REST as the foundation.

trans-unit.source: REST
trans-unit.target: REST

trans-unit.source: The REST API is the foundation of all programmatic interaction with the Key Vault.
trans-unit.target: The REST API is the foundation of all programmatic interaction with the Key Vault.

trans-unit.source: Key Vault has its own REST endpoint which is described in the [Key Vault REST API Reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903609.aspx)
trans-unit.target: Key Vault has its own REST endpoint which is described in the [Key Vault REST API Reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903609.aspx)

trans-unit.source: .NET
trans-unit.target: .NET

trans-unit.source: The .NET API is a set of wrappers that allows implementation through the C# programming model without needing to interact directly with the REST endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The .NET API is a set of wrappers that allows implementation through the C# programming model without needing to interact directly with the REST endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Here you can find the [Azure Key Vault .NET client API reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903301.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Here you can find the [Azure Key Vault .NET client API reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903301.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Node.js
trans-unit.target: Node.js

trans-unit.source: The Node.js API is a set of wrappers that allows implementation through the JavaScript programming model without needing to interact directly with the REST endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The Node.js API is a set of wrappers that allows implementation through the JavaScript programming model without needing to interact directly with the REST endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Here you can find the [Microsoft Azure SDK for Node.js - Key Vault Management](http://azure.github.io/azure-sdk-for-node/azure-arm-keyvault/latest/).
trans-unit.target: Here you can find the [Microsoft Azure SDK for Node.js - Key Vault Management](http://azure.github.io/azure-sdk-for-node/azure-arm-keyvault/latest/).

trans-unit.target: Managing Key Vault with PowerShell and CLI
